title: State election official loses his temper with Trump for not condemning violent actions
description: Gabriel Sterling, the Voting Systems Manager for the Georgia Secretary of State's office, said that he has police protection around his home after threats came in the aftermath of election results.

title: Doctors and nurses in the US: 'We don't feel like heroes anymore'
description: From running out of room at the morgue to caring for critically ill colleagues, many doctors and nurses on the frontlines of America's Covid-19 outbreak say they are at a breaking point.

title: Controversial member of White House Covid-19 task force resigns
How one Trump-loving governor totally shut down the President's voter fraud claims
description: In the month since the presidential election, President Donald Trump has repeatedly argued that Arizona's vote was somehow fraudulent because, uh, he lost.

title: Trump raises more than $170 million since Election Day as he pushes baseless fraud claims
Biden expected to introduce key members of economic team Tuesday
A unique Australian ecosystem is on fire
description: Firefighters in Australia are battling a massive bushfire that has been burning out of control for six weeks across the popular tourist spot of Fraser Island, as parts of the country's east swelter through a record-breaking heat wave following the hottest November on record.

title: 'Proud to partner with Bahrainis,' says F1 boss amid human rights criticism
description: The head of Formula One says the organization is "proud to partner with Bahrainis" as he responded to criticism about the kingdom's human rights record ahead of the first race in the Bahrain Grand Prix double header.

title: Lewis Hamilton to miss Sakhir Grand Prix after testing positive for coronavirus
description: Lewis Hamilton will miss this weekend's Sakhir Grand Prix in Bahrain after testing for Covid-19.

title: GOP silence on Trump's false election claims recalls McCarthy era
description:
• Georgia's lieutenant governor joins state GOP officials in rejecting Trump's 'misinformation'
• Analysis: Trump sees 'writing on the wall,' advisers say

title: Nasdaq to Corporate America: Make your boards more diverse or get out
description: Nasdaq is proposing a rule that would require at least some measure of diversity on the boards of directors of companies listed on the exchange.

title: Stunning images shortlisted for Wildlife Photographer of the Year People's Choice Award
description: A coconut octopus, a burning forest, a rare rhino's last moments and a pair of sleeping squirrels all feature in the shortlist for the Natural History Museum's Wildlife Photographer of the Year 2020 People's Choice Award.

title: Several dead and injured in Germany after car hits pedestrians, police say
description: Several people have been killed and left injured in Germany after a car was driven into a pedestrian zone in the town of Trier, according to the local police force.

title: Bill Cosby's legal team to argue his appeal in Pennsylvania Supreme Court today
description: Bill Cosby's legal team is set to argue in Pennsylvania Supreme Court on Tuesday that two key decisions in his criminal trial were wrongly decided.

title: 'Little, crappy' poinsettia grows into monster plant
description: A "little, crappy half-dead" plant is transformed into a MONSTER poinsettia. CNN's Jeanne Moos turns over a new and bigger leaf.

title: 25,000 jobs at risk as Debenhams closure follows Topshop collapse
description: Debenhams, Britain's biggest department store chain, is permanently closing its UK operations.

title: Fauci asks Americans to prepare to get vaccinated
description: As the US prepares for the first round of vaccinations to tackle Covid-19, infectious disease expert Dr. Anthony Fauci called on the public to "be part of the solution" and get vaccinated once it is available.

title: Ivy League Republicans criticize Biden's Ivy League cabinet picks
description: Prominent Republicans are criticizing President-elect Joe Biden's incoming cabinet picks for their Ivy League backgrounds, despite many of them having attended Ivy League schools themselves. CNN's John Avlon has the details.

title: Paul Walker's daughter and co-stars remember him on anniversary of his death
description: Paul Walker died in a car crash on November 30, 2013, and some people who loved him marked the day.

title: Auction offers chance to get up close and personal with the 'Mona Lisa'
description: One lucky bidder will have the chance to get up close and personal with the "Mona Lisa" thanks to a new auction from the Louvre museum in Paris.

title: Trump asks about status of vaccine emergency approval
description: White House chief of staff Mark Meadows is scheduled to meet with Food and Drug Administration Commissioner Stephen Hahn in the West Wing Tuesday, as President Donald Trump has privately demanded to know why the agency hasn't granted emergency use for Pfizer's coronavirus vaccine yet, according to two sources.

title: Boy thrown from London's Tate Modern gallery is starting to walk, family says
description: A boy who was thrown from a viewing platform at London's Tate Modern gallery last year has started to walk with a cane, his family has announced.

title: Late-night hosts mock Biden and Trump over recent missteps
description: Late-night hosts Trevor Noah, Jimmy Kimmel and Jimmy Fallon ridiculed President-elect Joe Biden for his accident while playing with his dog and then mocked President Trump for the size of his desk.

title: After 256 days working nonstop, doctor pleads with public
description: The Texas doctor captured on film cradling a distraught Covid-19 patient on Thanksgiving has spoken of the sad isolation of his elderly patients and pleaded with people to "do the basic things" to avoid infection and stay out of hospital.

title: These are YouTube's top trending videos of 2020
description: Comedy, oddity and tragedy.

title: This global airline has no passengers, no cargo and flies just one way
description: The team at Jet Test and Transport runs a global airline -- but the planes fly on a one-way trip without passengers or cargo.

title: Super Nintendo World is opening at Universal Studios Japan in February. Here's a sneak peek
description: Get ready to slap on your Mario Kart racing gear and toss some Koopa Shells.

title: Deforestation in Brazilian Amazon surges to 12-year high
description: Deforestation in the Brazilian Amazon surged to a 12-year high in the year between August 2019 and July 2020, according to the country's National Institute for Space Research (INPE).

title: Prosecutors investigate potential negligence in Maradona's death
description: Prosecutors investigating the death of Diego Maradona say the lack of adequate medical supervision provided following surgery for a subdural hematoma was "absolutely negligent," a judicial investigator involved in the case told the country's official news Agency Telam on Monday.

title: Tens of thousands of farmers swarm India's capital to protest deregulation rules
description: Tens of thousands of farmers have swarmed India's capital where they intend to camp out for weeks to protest new agricultural laws that they say could destroy their livelihoods.

title: Luxury resort carved into rocks in Saudi desert
description: The latest luxurious resort being built as part of Saudi Arabia's epic efforts to rebrand itself into a major tourism destination has been revealed as a stunning and ambitious project built into sandstone near a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

title: A slice of life from Ireland's lockdown
description: On December 1, Ireland begins a staggered re-opening following six weeks of a second nationwide lockdown to halt the spread of coronavirus. For one family in Dublin, the Martins, life under lockdown presented challenges, but also charms. They shared their experience with CNN in this video diary from the Emerald Isle.

title: Europe's Christmas is going to be a little different this year
description: As the year comes to an end, many of Europe's governments are scrambling to avoid stringent lockdowns over the Christmas holidays. CNN's Melissa Bell reports.

title: The mysterious origins of Moscow's multicolored landmark
description: After Saint Basil's Cathedral was completed in the mid-16th century, a legend began to circulate about the eclectic Orthodox church located in the heart of Moscow.

title: What every new mom should know about returning to work
description: In "The Working Mom's Handbook: A Survival Guide for Returning to Work After Having A Baby," Ali Velez Alderfer, mom to a 3-year-old and a CNN digital producer, outlines what every newly pregnant mom should think about and how to work and parent in a world in crisis.

title: The multinational company that's testing a four-day work week in New Zealand
description: Unilever has become the latest major company to hop on the four-day work week bandwagon, lending credence to the idea that flexible working is here to stay.

title: CNN's Don Lemon: Imagine how this feels for Trump
description: CNN's Don Lemon breaks down President Trump's refusal to accept the outcome of the election as his presidency comes to an end.

title: Coronavirus task force member Scott Atlas resigns
description: Dr. Scott Atlas, a highly controversial member of the White House's coronavirus task force, has resigned from his post in the Trump administration.

title: Experts skeptical that Iranian nuclear scientist was killed in 'remote control' assassination
description: Days after the assassination of Iranian nuclear scientist Mohsen Fakhrizadeh, the country's state media painted an elaborate picture of the killing that makes it sound like something straight out of a second-rate spy movie.
